title: Calories in a Teaspoon of Butter

h1: Calories in a Teaspoon of Butter
assumptions: Unsalted butter, standard table butter (about 5 g per teaspoon), at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (salted/unsalted), fat content, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of butter contains about 34 kcal, mostly from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Salted butter (adds sodium but similar calories)
Use grass-fed butter (slightly higher omega-3s, similar calories)
Substitute with margarine (lower sat fat option)

faqs.q: How many calories in a teaspoon of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 34 kcal for one teaspoon of unsalted butter.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat per teaspoon?
faqs.a: Yes, about 2.4 g saturated fat per teaspoon, which is notable for its small size.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories than unsalted?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same at ~34 kcal; only sodium increases.

faqs.q: What about cholesterol in a teaspoon of butter?
faqs.a: Around 10 mg per teaspoon, mainly from the dairy fat.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to olive oil per teaspoon?
faqs.a: Similar calories (~40 kcal for oil), but oil has no sat fat or cholesterol.
